https://www.devrant.io/api

devRant inofficial API documentation

API Endpoint
https://www.devrant.io/api

This aims to provide a full devRant API documentation written in the API blueprint format.

devRant ¶

Rants ¶

GET https://www.devrant.io/api/devrant/rants?app=3&plat=3&token_id=563363&token_key=mTknUFC$SHpZDB9QhGU8n4NEUFpz!EYERw48Sctj&user_id=644182&guid=7509943a-7ef0-11e7-bb31-be2e44b06b34&sid=1502483704000&seid=342&sort=algo&skip=10

List rants
GET/devrant/rants{?app,plat,token_id,token_key,user_id,guid,sid,seid,sort,skip}

Returns a JSON object with 20 rants. The rants.user_avatar.i-property defines the path of the user avatar image on the https://avatars.devrant.io/-host.

URI Parameters
HideShow
app
number (required) Example: 3

The ID of the app which is running the request. As far as tested, only the value 3 works here. Everything else results in the error “Invalid app id specified.”

plat
number (optional) Example: 3

The ID of the platform which the app is running on.

token_id
number (optional) Example: 563363

The token ID of the user currently logged in.

token_key
string (optional) Example: mTknUFC$SHpZDB9QhGU8n4NEUFpz!EYERw48Sctj

The token string of the user currently logged in.

user_id
number (optional) Example: 644182

The ID of the user currently logged in.

guid
string (optional) Example: 7509943a-7ef0-11e7-bb31-be2e44b06b34

Current GUID.

sid
number (optional) Example: 1502483704000

The unix timestamp in milliseconds when the session started.

seid
number (optional) Example: 342

An event ID that is incremented each request. It starts with 1 and is stored and reused in the next session.

sort
string (optional) Example: algo

“algo”, “recent” or “top”. Specifies the way returned rants will be sorted.

skip
number (optional) Example: 10

How many rants should be skipped (e.g. for pagination)

Users ¶

Users ¶

POST https://www.devrant.io/api/users?app=3&type=1&email=example@example.com&username=wildcard&password=nope :P&guid=1fee9f24-c00d-4a7e-8641-bd636725893e&plat=3&sid=1502483704000&seid=1
RequestsSuccessAlready existing usernameInvalid account typeInvalid email address
Body
{
  "app": 3,
  "type": 1,
  "email": "example@example.com",
  "username": "username",
  "password": "password"
}
Responses200
Headers
Content-Type: application/json
Body
{
  "success": true,
  "auth_token": {
    "id": 644182,
    "key": "mTknUFC$SHpZDB9QhGU8n4NEUFpz!EYERw48Sctj",
    "expire_time": 1505136041,
    "user_id": 771462
  }
}
Body
{
  "app": 3,
  "type": 1,
  "email": "example@example.com",
  "username": "already-existing-username",
  "password": "password"
}
Responses200
Headers
Content-Type: application/json
Body
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "The username specified is already registered to an account.",
  "error_field": "username"
}
Body
{
  "app": 3,
  "type": 2,
  "email": "example@example.com",
  "username": "already-existing-username",
  "password": "password"
}
Responses200
Headers
Content-Type: application/json
Body
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Invalid account type specified."
}
Body
{
  "app": 3,
  "type": 1,
  "email": "example",
  "username": "username",
  "password": "password"
}
Responses200
Headers
Content-Type: application/json
Body
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Please supply a valid email address.",
  "error_field": "email"
}

Register
POST/users{?app,type,email,username,password,guid,plat,sid,seid}

Registers an account at devRant.io.

URI Parameters
HideShow
app
number (required) Example: 3

The ID of the app which is running the request. As far as tested, only the value 3 works here. Everything else results in the error “Invalid app id specified.”

type
number (required) Example: 1

The account type. As far as tested, only the value 1 works here. Everything else results in an “invalid account type” error,

email
string (required) Example: example@example.com

Email address of the to-be-registered user.

username
string (required) Example: wildcard

Username

password
string (required) Example: nope :P

Password

guid
string (optional) Example: 1fee9f24-c00d-4a7e-8641-bd636725893e

Randomly generated UUIDv1 which is reused in ever request in the opened session.

plat
number (optional) Example: 3

The ID of the platform which the app is running on.

sid
number (optional) Example: 1502483704000

The unix timestamp in milliseconds when the session started.

seid
number (optional) Example: 1

An event ID that is incremented each request. It starts with 1 and is stored and reused in the next session.

GET https://www.devrant.io/api/users/644182?app=3
RequestsValid user idInvalid user idInvalid app id
Body
{
  "user_id": 644183,
  "app": 3
}
Responses200
Headers
Content-Type: application/json
Body
{
    "success": true,
    "profile": {
        "username": "wildcard",
        "score": 859,
        "about": "17 yo code enthusiast from Germany. Has been programming since he was 7.",
        "location": "Ingolstadt, Germany",
        "created_time": 1497221066,
        "skills": "JS, C, C++, C#, Go, Dart, Python, PHP, HTML, CSS",
        "github": "https://www.github.com/ThePlatzhalter",
        "website": "",
        "content": {
            "content": {
                "rants": [
                    // See Body.rants in the /devrant/rants GET response
                ],
                "upvoted": [
                    // See Body.rants in the /devrant/rants GET response
                ],
                "comments": [
                    // See: TODO
                ],
                "favorites": [
                    // TODO
                ]
            },
            "counts": {
                "rants": 20,
                "upvoted": 600,
                "comments": 116,
                "favorites": 1,
                "collabs": 0
            }
        },
        "avatar": {
            // See Body.rants.user_avatar in the /devrant/rants GET response
        },
        "dpp": 0 // TODO: Find out, what this does
    }
}
Body
{
  "user_id": 99999999,
  "app": 3
}
Responses400

Content-Type: application/json
Body
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Invalid user specified in path."
}

{
  "user_id": 644183,
  "app": 1
}
Responses400
Headers
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "success": false,
    "error": Invalid app id specified."
}

Get user information
GET/users/{user_id}{?app}

URI Parameters
HideShow
user_id
number (required) Example: 644182

The user id of the user whose information is requested

app
number (required) Example: 3

The ID of the app which is running the request. As far as tested, only the value 3 works here. Everything else results in the error “Invalid app id specified.”

Login ¶

POST https://www.devrant.io/api/users/auth-token?app=3&username=wildcard&password=nope :P&guid=49c4e417-0f96-4bf6-b923-1bf54005ee5d&sid=1504088781000&seid=1&plat=3
Responses200400
Headers
Content-Type: application/json
Body
{
  "success": "true",
  "auth_token": {
    "id": 644182,
    "key": "mTknUFC$SHpZDB9QhGU8n4NEUFpz!EYERw48Sctj",
    "expire_time": 1505134227,
    "user_id": 644182
  }
}
Headers
Content-Type: application/json
Body
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Invalid login credentials entered. Please try again."
}

Authenticate
POST/users/auth-token{?app,username,password,guid,sid,seid,plat}

Returns a authentication token as well as the expiration time of that token and the user id of the logged in user.

URI Parameters
HideShow
app
number (required) Example: 3

The ID of the app which is running the request. As far as tested, only the value 3 works here. Everything else results in the error “Invalid app id specified.”

username
string (required) Example: wildcard

Username

password
string (required) Example: nope :P

Password

guid
string (optional) Example: 49c4e417-0f96-4bf6-b923-1bf54005ee5d

Randomly generated UUIDv1 which is reused in ever request in the opened session.

sid
number (optional) Example: 1504088781000

The unix timestamp in milliseconds when the session started.

seid
number (optional) Example: 1

An event ID that is incremented each request. It starts with 1 and is stored and reused in the next session.

plat
number (optional) Example: 3

The ID of the platform which the app is running on.
